channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Her First 100K’ founder Tori Dunlap says investing right now is about managing your own panic

item.title: Why it’s almost impossible to find a new show to watch on cable TV

item.title: MBA programs are broken. Here’s how America can still create strong leaders.

item.title: This common investing habit could be keeping you from some profitable stocks
item.description: International stocks have outperformed the U.S. market so far this year. Check your portfolio for ‘home bias.’

item.title: Goldman Sachs sees clients craving policy certainty — and putting off decisions — as deal backlog grows
item.description: Goldman Sachs reported revenue drops in two of its three main business lines, but trading revenue was enough to satisfy investors.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.
